[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Modular Data Processing Framework defines requirements for data ingestion, processing, and analysis, ensuring integration with datasets and analytics tools.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: The framework supports batch and real-time processing, scalability, and secure communication, integrating with APIs, databases, and analytics.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: The framework integrates with APIs, data warehouses, and analytics platforms for data ingestion and processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: The framework provides a web GUI and CLI for workflow management, monitoring, and analytics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: The framework deploys on cloud, on-premise, and distributed environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: The framework supports standard OS and database systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: The framework ensures secure data transfer using encryption protocols for remote access and system management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The framework optimizes in-memory data processing for minimal latency and high throughput workloads.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: The framework supports continuous operation with scheduled maintenance and scaling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: The framework is configurable for varied data processing environments, including enterprise and research applications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: The framework integrates with cloud-based analytics services for extended data processing and visualization.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: The framework manages ingestion, transformation, analytics, and visualization of structured and unstructured data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for analysts, scientists, and IT admins experienced in data processing and analytics.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: The framework depends on network stability, API availability, and data formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: The framework assumes compatibility with industry-standard APIs, database protocols, and secure authentication mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Data Ingestion: The process of collecting and importing data for immediate use or storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The framework shall interface with external APIs for data collection.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The framework shall support secure communication protocols for data exchange and encryption (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The framework shall support batch and real-time event-driven data processing (REQ-PERF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The framework shall provide an analytics engine for data visualization and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive GUI for workflow management (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The framework shall process up to 1TB of data within some time (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall ensure ACID compliance for transaction reliability.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support schema-less storage for unstructured data, logs, and analytical outputs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system architecture shall be modular and scalable.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO/IEC 27001 for information security (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The framework shall support dynamic scaling for increased data loads, adaptive processing, and real-time insights.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The framework shall provide detailed audit logs for debugging and compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional, performance, and compliance testing ensure system reliability and robustness.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and configuration guides.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO/IEC 27001, API integration standards, and database protocols.
